SYSEXTD(8) System Manager's Manual SYSEXTD(8)

NAME

sysextd — system extension manager

DESCRIPTION

sysextd is a daemon that helps manage system extensions. It works in coordination with other daemons, with system extensions' host applications, and with the system extensions themselves. Users should not manually run sysextd; the daemon is automatically started when its services are needed.

FILES

/Library/SystemExtensions
System extensions and data managed by the daemon.

EXIT STATUS

The sysextd utility exits 0 on success, and >0 if an error occurs.

SEE ALSO

systemextensionsctl(8)

HISTORY

sysextd was introduced in macOS Catalina 10.15.

October 30, 2023 Darwin
